prompts: Aeruginascin: Also known as '4-PO-N-TMT', it is described as an active constituent of the mushroom Inocybe aeruginascens.
2C-B is usually taken orally, but can also be insufflated or vaporized.
The NBOMe series are substituted phenethylamines that are N-benzylated with a 2-methoxybenzyl group.
DMT is a derivative and structural analog of tryptamine and other psychedelic tryptamines.
Psilocybin is a prodrug that is converted in the body to psilocin which has psychoactive effects.
LSD is typically delivered orally, usually on an absorbent substrate such as blotter paper.
Mescaline occurs naturally in the peyote cactus, the San Pedro cactus, and the Peruvian torch cactus.
5-MeO-DMT is a naturally occurring tryptamine found in a variety of plant species.
The brew is often combined with plants containing DMT, such as Psychotria viridis.
Bufotenine is found in the skin and parotid glands of cane toads.
Turinabol (): Also known as 4-Chlorodehydromethyltestosterone, this is a testosterone-based designer anabolic steroid.
Mephedrone, also known as 4-methylmethcathinone (4-MMC) or 4-methylephedrone, is a synthetic stimulant drug of the cathinone and amphetamine classes.
C-Liquid (): A street name for 5F-CUMYL-PINACA (SGT-25), an indazole-based synthetic cannabinoid.
Many fentanyl analogues have been sold as "heroin" on the street, sometimes mixed with heroin itself.
α-Pyrrolidinopentiophenone (α-PVP) is a synthetic stimulant drug of the cathinone class.
Methoxetamine (MXE) is a dissociative anesthetic drug that has been sold as a designer drug.
Nitrous oxide is used in surgery and dentistry for its anesthetic and analgesic effects.
Ketamine is a dissociative anesthetic used in human and veterinary medicine.
MDMA is commonly associated with rave parties, nightclubs, and electronic dance music.
Paramethoxyamphetamine (PMA), also known as 4-methoxyamphetamine (4-MA), is a stimulant and psychedelic drug.
Pulmozyme and tobramycin: These drugs were developed with aid from the Orphan Drug Act (ODA) and revolutionized the treatment for cystic fibrosis.
Soliris: This drug, manufactured by Alexion Pharmaceuticals, was considered the most expensive drug in the world by 2010.

Thalidomide, sold under the brand names Contergan and Thalomid among others, is an oral medication used to treat a number of cancers (e.g., multiple myeloma), graft-versus-host disease, and many skin disorders (e.g., complications of leprosy such as skin lesions).

Its products include eculizumab (Soliris) and ravulizumab (Ultomiris), both used to treat the rare disorders of atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS) and paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH)...
Cystic fibrosis (CF) is a genetic disorder that affects mostly the lungs, but also the pancreas, liver, intestines, sinuses, and sex organs.
Wilson's disease is a rare genetic disorder that prevents the body from removing extra copper.
Hypophosphatasia (HPP) is a rare genetic disorder characterized by abnormal mineralization of bones and teeth.
Lysosomal acid lipase deficiency (LAL-D) is a rare, inherited genetic disorder that can lead to serious health problems.
Spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) is a group of hereditary diseases that progressively destroys motor neurons.
Atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS) is a rare, genetic disease that causes tiny blood clots to form in the small blood vessels throughout the body.
Some of the drugs mentioned in the list include: Acamprosate, Adrafinil, Amantadine, Anagrelide, Armodafinil...
The mechanism of action of paracetamol is not completely understood.
A.B.C. Liniment: This liniment was named for its three primary ingredients: aconite, belladonna, and chloroform.
Chlorodyne: this combination of laudanum, tincture of cannabis, and chloroform was marketed as a cure-all, but frequently caused addiction and overdoses.
Radithor was a patent medicine marketed as a cure for various ailments.
Mrs. Winslow's Soothing Syrup was a patent medicine marketed to parents as a remedy for colicky babies.
Fuel oil: Specifically mentioned in the context of ANFO (Ammonium Nitrate Fuel Oil), a widely used industrial explosive...
The cyanide ion CN − is one of the most poisonous chemicals. It may cause death in minutes.
Barrelene: Its name comes from its resemblance to a barrel. The chemical formula is C<sub>8</sub>H<sub>8</sub>.
Nickel is a chemical element; it has symbol Ni and atomic number 28.
